result.execSummary:
The defendant James Arthur Chute Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

- Report to probation by 9/8/21.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

DA Anderson states DE hasn't completed psych eval or AODA and the State is not willing to give any more extensions. State is seeking revocation and further states Kevin Carroll is present from Diversion to testify. Atty Wertheimer responds and states Defendant has been working long hours at least 6 days a week and requests more time. Court reviews file. Court DENIES request for more time. Atty Wertheimer isn't stating that DE has completed and isn't requesting to take testimony. DA Anderson requests Court find stipulated fact and enters conviction. Atty Wertheimer requests to set sentencing hearing out. Court sets SEH in person. Court notes returned mail rec'd for DE. - Comply with DJOC

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Patricia Z., Joshua Z., Jennifer P. or Jennifer F.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Not to possess any firearms 

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Karl E. Anderson   DF ATTY:  Robert A Wertheimer   DF:  James Arthur Chute appeared. Case called at 11:21 am. Court reviews file. ADA Anderson recites agreement. Guilty to all counts. Defferred JMT on Count #1. No objection from Atty Wertheimer.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Counts #1, #2, #3 and #4. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Counts #2, #3 and #4. Court withholds entering conviction in Count #1 in favor of Deferred Judgment of Conviction. ADA Anderson makes sentencing argument. Atty Wertheimer makes statement. Def makes statement. On Counts #2 - #4 Court orders: 3 years probation - 
On Count #4 - 60 Days Jail i/s - 
Counts #3 and #2 - 3 yrs probation w/h

and _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $750.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.


-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Joshua Z., Jennifer P. or Jennifer F.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Not to possess any firearms and turn them in to the St. Croix County Sheriff. 

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.
